question.para: What existing core infrastructure services are required or recommended to run the &productname; platform?

answer.para: On-premise you need to run the following services:

listitem.para: The service is required for the &admin_node; and the &kmaster; as the nodes must have resolvable A entries that can be resolved within the L2 subnet as well as from any client accessing the cluster. &kworker;s are able to resolve the &kmaster; by using the hosts file entry that is managed by &salt;. The hosts file entry points to the &kmaster; fqdn entered into &dashboard;. Resolvable FQDNS are no longer required for &kworker;s as &salt; keeps the hosts file up to date with a reference for each node to every other node's unique hostname (using the &sminion; ID). &productabbr; uses <saltminionID>.infra.caasp.local for referencing all nodes.

Is recommended for large-scale clusters. As &salt; manages cluster nodes hosts files there is no need to use static IP addresses. Ensure that DNS entries for the &admin_node; and the &kmaster; are always correct and up-to-date. For this purpose, the DHCP server can be configured to automatically update the DNS server for each host name.

The installer asks for an NTP server address. As &suse; does not have a corporate subdomain alias in pool.ntp.org, you need to choose NTP servers for your region or use your company own NTP servers (required for clusters that do not have external Internet access). The &admin_node; runs ntpd, other cluster nodes run systemd-timesyncd daemon configured to point to the &admin_node;
